meanings.definition: To take and use (something that belongs to someone else) with the intention of returning it.
meanings.sent1: I will borrow your book and give it back tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: Can I borrow your pen for a moment?
meanings.sent3: I decided to borrow my sister's sweater without asking, oops!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to borrow joy from the sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The student had to borrow a calculator for the math test.

meanings.definition: To take and use (money) that will be paid back with interest.
meanings.sent1: He needed to borrow some money to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent2: The bank agreed to let her borrow a loan for her business.
meanings.sent3: I had to borrow some cash from my friend to pay for lunch.
meanings.sent4: His confidence seemed to borrow strength from his determination.
meanings.sent5: She had to borrow a significant amount to cover the unexpected expenses.

meanings.definition: To adopt or take over (an idea, method, etc.) from someone else.
meanings.sent1: I decided to borrow her study technique for the exam.
meanings.sent2: The company chose to borrow the successful marketing strategy.
meanings.sent3: He tried to borrow his friend's excuse for being late, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity seemed to borrow inspiration from nature.
meanings.sent5: The team decided to borrow the concept of teamwork from the winning team.
